channel.title: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able
channel.description:
Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able to start the server when I am not on?
Like if it goes down, because I have been off for a while and i want him to start it. I don't want to send the source file. because i dont know what he could do. please help!! also is there a mute command for testscape?
help appreciated :)

item.title: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able
item.dc:creator: @Pur3_Mag3 Pur3 Mag3
item.description:
@Pur3_Mag3 wrote:

Auto Restarter might help…

Read full topic

item.title: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able
item.dc:creator: @llama_man111 llama man111
item.description:
@llama_man111 wrote:

Well, i do, but if the server goes down, because of fast clicking, or some other reason, then it cant be started[br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2007, 07:02:24 PM[/size][hr]anyone have any other ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able

item.title: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Well, you could if you’re willing to give the other person complete access to your computer over the network.

But why don’t you just start the server before you leave ?

Read full topic
item.source: Is there any possible way for a co-owner to be able
